revised_title: Observations on Human Longevity, Fish Breeding, and Local Fauna
tldr: The author shares observations on human longevity, fish breeding, and local fauna in North Bierley, Yorkshire. Notable findings include a boy who lived to 17 without urinating, two sisters living to 104 and 107, and fish surviving out of water for an extended period. The author also discusses trout and char breeding habits, the small size of fish in mountain lakes, and the nut-hatch bird's ability to crack nuts.
